laboratory_examinations.findings: Of poor quality owing to the patient’s severe pectus excavatum.
Restrictive pattern with a vital capacity of 2.50 L (66% of predicted) and total lung capacity of 3.32 L (65% of predicted).
Demonstrated a drop in both blood pressure and pulse wave amplitude during the test.
Marked compression of the inferior vena cava (IVC); cross-sectional area decreased from 6 cm² and 21 mm during inspiration to 1.2 cm² and 3 mm during expiration.
Significantly increased mean IVC flow velocity at end expiration with marked blunting of the normally biphasic flow pattern.
Anterior-posterior intrathoracic distance of 1.2 cm; pectus severity index calculated at 18.8 (severe).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Postoperative CT revealed no IVC compression during maximal expiration and improvement in the minimal expiratory thoracic depth from 1.2 cm to 5.7 cm.
